description: London was once encircled by a ring of powerful religious institutions swept away by the Dissolution, the Great Fire and the Blitz, and yet miraculously some traces remain. This walk will look for evidence of London’s monastic past.

events.name: Monastic London Guided Walk by Rob Humphreys
Monastic London Guided Walk by Rob Humphreys

factsheet.heading: History – background
paragraphs:
This walk is going back to a time to when the London boasted over 100 churches and, most importantly over 20 religious houses, which formed a ring around the City.
• Due to the Dissolution of the Monasteries in the 1530s, the Great Fire of London in 1666, and the Blitz of World War Two, there’s little left of monastic London, but this walk will look for the clues and uncover the surviving remnants of those days.
• En route, this walk will sort out your monks from your friars and your Greyfriars from your Blackfriars.

location.meeting_point: Meet in front of the Gates to The Charterhouse

name: Monastic London
